page.title: 17Village Church (Part 2)
page.content: The church boasts{2 Victorian stained {glass windows.}1 in the{chancel}dated {1874}shows two miracles.The second is in the{tower.}Made by Ward & Hughes of London is dated{1881}and shows Jesus' baptism.The{church organ}was installed in{1906}in memory of{John Arkwright}of the nearby{Hampton Court Estate,}which he owned.On the magnificent lecturn rests the large green leather-bound {Church Bible}dated{1879.}The carved stone{font}is{13th century}and boasts a{17th century,}carved wooden{cover. In front of the altar are early 18th century wooden communion rails.A stone {incised slab}on the wall in the north chapel shows{Humfry Conygsbye,1559,his {wife,3 sons and 4 daughters.}Another {monument to the Coningsby family 1760, shows parents & child who choked to death on a cherry stone in 1708.Mother holds the child who holds a cherry.
